001package org.consensusj.jsonrpc;
002
003import org.slf4j.Logger;
004import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
005
006import javax.net.ssl.SSLContext;
007import javax.net.ssl.TrustManager;
008import javax.net.ssl.TrustManagerFactory;
009import javax.net.ssl.X509TrustManager;
010import java.io.FileInputStream;
011import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
012import java.io.IOException;
013import java.io.InputStream;
014import java.nio.file.Path;
015import java.security.KeyManagementException;
016import java.security.KeyStore;
017import java.security.KeyStoreException;
018import java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException;
019import java.security.cert.CertificateException;
020import java.security.cert.X509Certificate;
021import java.util.ArrayList;
022import java.util.Arrays;
023import java.util.List;
024
025/**
026 * A Trust Manager that adds a second trust store (key store) to the default trust store.
027 * See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48790981/load-java-trust-store-at-runtime-after-jvm-have-been-launched/58695061#58695061
028 */
029public class CompositeTrustManager implements X509TrustManager {
030    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(CompositeTrustManager.class);
031    private static final char[] password = new char[]{'c','h','a','n','g','e','i','t'};
032
033    private final List<X509TrustManager> trustManagerList;
034
035    /**
036     * @param trustStoreStream Input stream for Java keystore with additional certificates
037     */
038    public CompositeTrustManager(InputStream trustStoreStream) {
039        List<X509TrustManager> trustManagers = new ArrayList<>();
040        try {
041            trustManagers.add(getCustomTrustManager(trustStoreStream));
042            trustManagers.add(getDefaultTrustManager());
043        } catch (Exception e) {
044            log.error("Exception: ", e);
045            throw new RuntimeException(e);
046        } finally {
047            try {
048                trustStoreStream.close();
049            } catch (IOException e) {
050                log.error("Exception: ", e);
051            }
052        }
053        trustManagerList = trustManagers;
054    }
055
056    /**
057     * @param trustStorePath Path to a Java keystore with additional certificates
058     * @throws FileNotFoundException If the file doesn't exist
059     */
060    public CompositeTrustManager(Path trustStorePath) throws FileNotFoundException {
061        this(new FileInputStream(trustStorePath.toFile()));
062    }
063
064    /**
065     * Used to create an SSLContext using {@link CompositeTrustManager}
066     * See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/859111/how-can-i-use-different-certificates-on-specific-connections
067     */
068    public static SSLContext getCompositeSSLContext(Path trustStorePath) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, KeyManagementException, FileNotFoundException {
069        TrustManager tm = new CompositeTrustManager(trustStorePath);
070        return getSSLContext(tm);
071    }
072
073
074    /**
075     * Used to create an SSLContext using {@link CompositeTrustManager}
076     * See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/859111/how-can-i-use-different-certificates-on-specific-connections
077     */
078    public static SSLContext getCompositeSSLContext(InputStream trustStoreStream) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, KeyManagementException {
079        TrustManager tm = new CompositeTrustManager(trustStoreStream);
080        return getSSLContext(tm);
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * Create an SSLContext using an alternative Trust Store
085     */
086    public static SSLContext getAlternateSSLContext(Path trustStorePath) throws KeyStoreException, IOException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, KeyManagementException, CertificateException {
087        return getAlternateSSLContext(new FileInputStream(trustStorePath.toFile()));
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Create an SSLContext using an alternative Trust Store
092     * @param trustStoreStream inputStream with Trust Store (password must be 'changeit')
093     */
094    public static SSLContext getAlternateSSLContext(InputStream trustStoreStream) throws KeyStoreException, IOException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, KeyManagementException, CertificateException {
095        X509TrustManager trustManager = getCustomTrustManager(trustStoreStream);
096        return getSSLContext( trustManager );
097    }
098
099    private static SSLContext getSSLContext(TrustManager trustManager) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, KeyManagementException {
100        SSLContext ctx = SSLContext.getInstance("TLS");
101        ctx.init(null, new TrustManager[] {trustManager}, null);
102        return ctx;
103    }
104
105    @Override
106    public void checkClientTrusted(X509Certificate[] chain, String authType) throws CertificateException {
107        for (X509TrustManager trustManager : trustManagerList) {
108            try {
109                trustManager.checkClientTrusted(chain, authType);
110                return;
111            } catch (CertificateException e) {
112                // maybe the next trust manager will trust it, don't break the loop
113            }
114        }
115        throw new CertificateException("None of the TrustManagers trust this certificate chain");
116    }
117
118    @Override
119    public void checkServerTrusted(X509Certificate[] chain, String authType) throws CertificateException {
120        for (X509TrustManager trustManager : trustManagerList) {
121            try {
122                trustManager.checkServerTrusted(chain, authType);
123                return;
124            } catch (CertificateException e) {
125                // maybe the next trust manager will trust it, don't break the loop
126            }
127        }
128        throw new CertificateException("None of the TrustManagers trust this certificate chain");
129    }
130
131    @Override
132    public X509Certificate[] getAcceptedIssuers() {
133        List<X509Certificate> certs = new ArrayList<>();
134        for (X509TrustManager trustManager : trustManagerList) {
135            certs.addAll(Arrays.asList(trustManager.getAcceptedIssuers()));
136        }
137        return certs.toArray(new X509Certificate[0]);
138    }
139
140    private static X509TrustManager getCustomTrustManager(InputStream trustStream) throws CertificateException, KeyStoreException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, IOException {
141        return createTrustManager(trustStream);
142    }
143
144    private static X509TrustManager getDefaultTrustManager() throws CertificateException, KeyStoreException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, IOException {
145        return createTrustManager(null);
146    }
147
148    private static X509TrustManager createTrustManager(InputStream trustStream) throws KeyStoreException, NoSuchAlgorithmException, CertificateException, IOException {
149        // Now get trustStore
150        KeyStore trustStore = KeyStore.getInstance(KeyStore.getDefaultType());
151
152        // load the stream to your store
153        trustStore.load(trustStream, password);
154
155        // initialize a trust manager factory with the trusted store
156        TrustManagerFactory trustFactory = TrustManagerFactory.getInstance(TrustManagerFactory.getDefaultAlgorithm());
157        trustFactory.init(trustStore);
158
159        // get the trust managers from the factory
160        TrustManager[] trustManagers = trustFactory.getTrustManagers();
161        for (TrustManager trustManager : trustManagers) {
162            if (trustManager instanceof X509TrustManager) {
163                return (X509TrustManager) trustManager;
164            }
165        }
166        throw new CertificateException("No X509TrustManager available");
167    }
168}
